name: Novotel London Tower Bridge

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in July for two nights. We stayed in a new room, which was average size for London Hotels, in other words small but comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Hotel,Fantastic location, Would stay again. Nice rooms!!
London trip
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a new Deluxe room so this review is based on the new rooms as I did not see the rest of the hotel rooms.

The rooms were very nicely set out with nice beds, bedding and very comfortable mattresses, something we did not experience in the rest of Europe with their usual concrete beds, but this hotel bed was great.

The Bathroom was compact but not small and the shower was awesome, with excellent pressure and showerheads. The shower was a glass open shower so you could see through to the room and vice versa but you press a button and the glass becomes clouded and obscure so it is no longer see through... very interesting concept which makes the room look larger until the button is pressed.
reviews.title: Good value for the money, fine location

reviews.text: Staff were great and very attentive.
reviews.title: A little on the expensive side!

reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location which is why I rated it so highly. It is directly behind the Tower of London. The tube station is right around the corner and there is also a bus stop close by. The hotel itself is average. I stayed here with my family of 4. The room was small, but the hotel rooms in Europe are smaller than in the US generally.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: My only complaint was with the car service this hotel uses. It was extremely unreliable and I would highly recommend NOT using the car company the hotel associates with. Ask for them to arrange a London Black cab instead. The hotel claims the service they use is cheaper, but I don't believe that it actually is. The hotel did say that they have never had problems with this company, but I had the hotel book a car for us 3 times during our stay. Only once did the car service work out. The other two times we almost missed our Stonehenge tour and then almost missed our flight out of Heathrow. The car never showed up to take us to Heathrow even though I confirmed the night before that it would be there for us. After waiting and asking numerous times where the car was the hotel ended up calling (after my insisting on it) a London Black cab for us which showed 10 minutes later and got us to the airport in record time.
reviews.title: Awesome Location! Fantastic Breakfast!

reviews.text: I would stay here again without hesitation. The hotel is average, but in a really good location. The only thing I would change is using a reputable cab company like London Black cab instead of the company the hotel uses. Live and Learn!!!
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel. Would stay again

reviews.text: My family and I always stay in this hotel when we come to London for a weekend. We originally chose it for it's fantastic location (next to The Tower Of London and the Circle/District Line Tube Station) but have since been back many times as we always get exactly what we need - good quality, reliable (important with young children) accommodation. This means we can relax with the knowledge that our hotel is going to be just what we need for the weekend.

reviews.text: This hotel is perfect for location and ammenities. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Service is very much a priority for this hotel. Luca was especially helpful - thank you!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - highly recommend

reviews.text: Rooms clean, generous space, and well stocked with all that you need. We would stay there again for sure!
reviews.title: Room was small but all good apart from that
Great service, excellent family accommodation in quiet location

reviews.text: Hotel was really close to attractions such as london tower bridge and the Tower of london and was in the heart of the city. You could walk to lots of things. More comprehensive room service would have been good eg more range 24 hours and the room was small but thats about the only issue. The staff were helpful and friendly. Hotel was close to all public transport too which was good and the all important tour buses. Rooms are never going to be cheap in London and so close to the city but this hotel was okay. Breakfast was excellent downstairs. Again not cheap but great range.
reviews.title: A simple elegant hotel in the heart of London

reviews.text: We spent the last nights of our UK trip this week at this Novotel, and I was blown away by how modern and sleek this property is - and how efficient the service is. Living in Asia, you get spoilt, and I had not expected such a great service experience from a huge chain like Novotel - especially not in the UK. But eat my words. From check-in, to the restaurant managers responsible for the breakfast sittings, from the super speedy room service (surprisingly good menu) to the cleaning staff - it's seamless. On top of that, you are a stone's throw from the Tower of London, but it's in an almost whisper quiet location(being in the City, the weekends are dead when you are away from the touristy bit of the Tower), and there are plenty of budget-friendly local bars and eateries such as Subway, Pizza Express, All Bar One and Wagamama close by. Only downside is the lack of free wi-fi, although if you can time it, you can use the two computers in the iMac hub for free at the lobby.
reviews.title: Expensive, low quality furniture and bedding

description: The Novotel London Tower Bridge is located in the City of London. Offering 6 meeting rooms and WiFi internet access for business travellers, the hotel is also a superb base for those on holiday in London. Situated opposite the Tower of London on the Thames close to Tower Bridge and St Pauls Cathedral. Take a short tube ride to the London Eye, Tate Modern, Millennium Bridge or the West End theatre and shopping areas. The hotel has Garden Brasserie restaurant, Pepys Bar, gym, sauna and steam room.
